events: Planned cutover: enabled cloud-managed secondary for 12 pilot zones; verified NS sets and SOA serial increments.
Detected intermittent SOA serial mismatch on 3 zones due to delayed IXFR application on bind-slave-02; forced retransfer using AXFR.
TTL reduction rollout for api.example.com records (3600->300) completed for 5 zones; one rollback after stakeholder flagged increased upstream query volume.
DNSSEC signer queue briefly backed up after KSK rollover simulation; cleared by increasing signer worker threads from 4 to 6.
episodes.on_call: Shift: R. Patel. 3 pages. 7 tickets. Status: Stable after minor transfer remediation; monitoring propagation and DNSSEC validations.

events: Completed delegation review for pilot zones; removed one stale NS entry left in registrar configuration.
Ran dry-run of bulk record import for 20 additional zones; validation flagged 3 CNAME-at-apex issues; corrected templates.
Observed minor increase in NXDOMAIN due to decommissioned legacy hostnames; added temporary wildcard record in staging only for testing, not promoted.
Scheduled DNSSEC ZSK rotation window; verified DS records remain consistent and monitored bogus validation events (none material).
episodes.on_call: Shift: L. Nguyen. 1 pages. 5 tickets. Status: Normal; proceeding with staged expansion after template fixes.

events: Imported 16 new zones into cloud-managed DNS; post-import lint found 11 issues (mostly missing trailing dots, SPF TXT quoting).
TSIG authentication failures started for a subset of transfers after key rotation; corrected key name mismatch on bind-slave-02 and retried AXFR.
Detected DS mismatch for one zone after registrar update lag; paused DNSSEC publish for that zone and coordinated registrar resync.
Two TTL change rollbacks executed after stakeholders reported prolonged stale answers at some resolvers; restored TTL from 120 back to 900 for critical A records.
episodes.on_call: Shift: S. Ahmed. 4 pages. 9 tickets. Status: Degraded during import window; stabilized after TSIG fix and DNSSEC hold on one zone.

events: Re-ran lint and normalization across newly imported zones; reduced errors from 11 to 4 by fixing TXT escaping and missing origin suffixes.
Performed controlled IXFR catch-up to cloud-managed secondary; SOA serial mismatches dropped from 6 to 2.
Implemented rate limiting adjustment for ANY queries; refused count steady and truncation decreased.
Validated DNSSEC chain for previously paused zone after registrar DS sync; resumed signing and monitored for bogus validations.
episodes.on_call: Shift: M. Chen. 2 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Healthy; continued cleanup and verified DNSSEC correctness.

events: Added 16 more zones to cloud-managed DNS; completed NS delegation tests from 10 external resolvers with consistent answers.
Rolled TTL standardization (most A/AAAA set to 3600) for 8 zones; one rollback for a CDN alias due to partner requirement of 300.
Enabled prefetch for additional resolver POPs; cache hit rate improved and propagation averages remained stable.
Closed out old on-prem monitoring checks for decommissioned slave; updated runbook to reflect cloud sync controller ownership.
episodes.on_call: Shift: J. Silva. 1 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Stable; migration progressing on schedule with minor TTL exception.

events: Added new cloud edge site in region expansion; validated authoritative reachability and compared response codes before/after.
Noted brief NTP drift on bind nodes (offset up to 8ms) causing sporadic TSIG verification warnings; resynced time and cleared alerts.
Audit pipeline missed one hour of DNS change logs due to storage rotation misconfig; backfilled from cloud provider audit export.
SOA serial mismatch seen on 2 zones after dynamic updates; forced immediate IXFR from master and confirmed parity.
episodes.on_call: Shift: A. Johnson. 3 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Stable after time sync and audit backfill; watching NTP and TSIG logs.

events: Migrated another batch of 16 zones; executed automated smoke tests for A/AAAA/MX/TXT parity against on-prem results.
Adjusted TTLs for mail-related records (MX and SPF) to 1800 for 9 zones; one rollback after mail vendor advised keeping 3600 for anti-spam heuristics.
Updated cloud sync controller to include zone-level locking to avoid overlapping IXFR apply tasks; queue depth reduced.
External validation run confirmed no lame delegations; cleaned up one outdated glue record at registrar.
episodes.on_call: Shift: K. O'Brien. 2 pages. 8 tickets. Status: Normal; completed batch migration and documented TTL exception for mail vendor.

events: Completed weekend maintenance: rotated cloud API credentials for DNS sync controller; verified least-privilege roles and successful test applies.
Ran end-to-end propagation drill on 20 representative records; p95 propagation improved after lowering batch size per change set.
Decommissioned one on-prem monitoring agent that was generating format error noise due to outdated query syntax.
Updated runbook sections for DS publishing workflow and registrar coordination checklist.
episodes.on_call: Shift: D. Wallace. 0 pages. 3 tickets. Status: Quiet shift; preventive maintenance completed successfully.

events: High-volume dynamic updates from internal tooling increased IXFR churn; sync controller queue depth peaked at 18 and propagation p95 rose above 300s.
TSIG failures observed on transfers for a subset of newly migrated zones; traced to inconsistent key algorithm setting (hmac-sha256 vs hmac-sha512) between master and cloud.
Emergency change: temporarily raised minimum TTL from 60 to 300 on frequently updated records to reduce churn; one rollback where short TTL was contractually required.
Signer load increased due to rapid update cadence; tuned signature refresh scheduling and confirmed bogus validation events remained low.
episodes.on_call: Shift: E. Romero. 5 pages. 11 tickets. Status: Degraded during update storm; mitigations applied and transfer auth settings aligned.

events: Post-incident cleanup: standardized TSIG algorithms across remaining zones; confirmed transfer success rates recovered.
Reduced dynamic update frequency in internal tooling from 60s to 180s where acceptable; saw queue depth and propagation p95 improve.
Ran SOA serial reconciliation job; only one zone required manual bump due to prior failed change set.
Updated alert thresholds for signer queue depth based on observed load patterns during update storm.
episodes.on_call: Shift: T. Kowalski. 2 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Recovering; metrics trending back to baseline after configuration standardization.

events: Migrated 16 zones with DNSSEC enabled from day one; verified DS publishing order and validated from external resolvers.
Adjusted monitoring to include per-zone propagation SLO and stale answer sampling; initial baselines captured.
Removed legacy allow-transfer ACL entries on BIND master for retired slaves; confirmed no unintended AXFR blocks for cloud endpoints.
Reviewed negative caching behavior; tuned SOA minimum values for 5 zones to reduce prolonged NXDOMAIN caching after record creation.
episodes.on_call: Shift: P. Singh. 1 pages. 5 tickets. Status: Stable; successful DNSSEC-enabled migrations and improved monitoring coverage.

events: Cloud sync controller applied a delayed batch after maintenance window; observed temporary propagation p95 increase; verified eventual consistency across edges.
Two zones showed SOA serial mismatch after concurrent edits in git and manual console change; enforced change policy: console edits disabled for production projects.
Lint detected 6 issues after importing partner-managed subzones; corrected NS target formatting and removed duplicate TXT segments.
Created new dashboard for transfer latency and TSIG failures; set alerts on p95 > 1800ms and failures > 2 per hour.
episodes.on_call: Shift: C. Martinez. 2 pages. 7 tickets. Status: Stable; addressed process gap around console edits and improved observability.

events: Expanded to 36 cloud edge sites; validated reachability and observed improved p95 propagation after edge addition.
Migrated next batch of 16 zones; executed DNS record parity tests including SRV and CAA records; no discrepancies found.
Removed remaining console write permissions for production DNS project; all changes now via IaC pipeline with approvals.
Completed DNSSEC ZSK rotation for 10 zones; monitored for bogus validations and found none material.
episodes.on_call: Shift: H. Kim. 1 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Normal; successful batch migration and security hardening for change controls.

events: Propagation delays increased after a large bulk TXT update (DKIM keys) across 6 zones; queue depth rose and stale answer sampling hit 1.2%.
TSIG failures reappeared for two zones; discovered mismatched TSIG key secret due to stale secret in sync controller; rotated and redeployed secret store entry.
One IaC change failed due to exceeding provider record-set size limits for aggregated TXT entries; split records and re-applied successfully.
Detected lame delegation for one subzone after registrar glue update; corrected parent NS set and confirmed authoritative reachability.
episodes.on_call: Shift: N. Brooks. 4 pages. 10 tickets. Status: Degraded during bulk TXT change; restored normal after secret rotation and record-set refactor.

events: Post-bulk-change verification: compared TXT records across 20 external resolvers; stale answer rate returned to baseline.
Migrated 16 additional zones; introduced automated check for provider record-set size constraints to prevent future apply failures.
Rotated sync controller secret store entries with version pinning to avoid stale secret deployment; documented in runbook.
Validated DS and DNSKEY alignment for all signed zones; scheduled next KSK ceremony tabletop exercise.
episodes.on_call: Shift: I. Hassan. 1 pages. 5 tickets. Status: Stable; preventive automation added and bulk-change effects resolved.

events: Implemented CAA record standard across 7 zones; verified no unintended impacts on issuance workflows and ensured consistent TTL 1800.
Tuned negative caching SOA minimum in two zones to align with policy; reduced prolonged NXDOMAIN caching risk during migrations.
Enabled additional resolver prefetch coverage (78%); observed small improvement in cache hit rate.
Conducted spot checks for glue record correctness at registrar for newly migrated zones; no issues found.
episodes.on_call: Shift: G. Thompson. 0 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Normal; standards work completed with clean validation.

events: Migrated 16 zones; added automated SRV record validation for SIP-related services to ensure priority/weight integrity.
One SOA serial mismatch flagged after manual hotfix in git; resolved by rebuilding zone and reapplying through pipeline.
Minor TSIG warning observed on one transfer; confirmed time sync and reloaded key; no recurrence.
Updated rate limiting policy for malformed queries; format errors decreased after tuning drop thresholds.
episodes.on_call: Shift: V. Petrov. 1 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Stable; minor serial mismatch corrected and new validation checks added.

events: Completed DNSSEC signing enablement for 2 additional zones; verified key TTLs and signature validity windows match policy.
Performed registrar audit for NS and DS records across top 50 zones; no mismatches detected; documented findings for compliance.
Ran load test of cloud edge queries; confirmed stable response latency and low TCP fallback.
Implemented commit hook to block CNAME-at-apex and oversized TXT sets before pipeline apply.
episodes.on_call: Shift: S. Laurent. 0 pages. 3 tickets. Status: Normal; compliance audit and guardrails improved.

events: Migrated 16 zones during peak query period; observed temporary increase in transfer latency and propagation p95; rescheduled remaining migrations to off-peak.
One change failed due to missing NS record in child zone delegation; corrected hierarchy and re-applied pipeline.
Lame delegation alert triggered for one subzone after partial registrar update; validated glue and completed registrar correction.
Performed targeted TTL reduction (1800->120) for incident response readiness on 10 zones; rolled back one zone with strict vendor requirements.
episodes.on_call: Shift: B. Fischer. 4 pages. 9 tickets. Status: Elevated activity during peak migration; stabilized by rescheduling and fixing delegation gaps.

events: Moved remaining planned migrations to off-peak window; completed dry-run validation scripts against production data without applying changes.
Normalized TTLs back to 300+ for zones that had temporary 120s; confirmed propagation and cache hit stability.
Closed lame delegation follow-up actions; registrar confirmations recorded in audit notes.
Updated SLO doc: propagation p95 target 180s for standard changes; added escalation steps for sustained stale answers above 1%.
episodes.on_call: Shift: R. Ivanov. 1 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Normal; process improvements applied after prior peak-window issues.

events: Migrated 16 zones off-peak; clean transfer stats and improved propagation p95 relative to peak-window attempts.
Enabled prefetch for 2 more resolver POPs (82% coverage); cache hit rate improved slightly.
Executed bulk update of CAA and DMARC TXT records across 9 zones; ensured record-set size constraints respected via pre-check.
Reviewed DNSSEC signature validity window parameters; confirmed uniform policy across signed zones.
episodes.on_call: Shift: F. Delgado. 0 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Normal; off-peak migrations proceeding smoothly with improved cache performance.

events: Noted slight propagation p95 increase after provider maintenance notice; monitored and confirmed no sustained impact beyond 2 hours.
One SOA serial mismatch on a rarely updated zone; resolved by triggering manual IXFR and validating serial parity.
Lint found 5 issues on newly onboarded zonefiles from acquisition; corrected inconsistent SPF TXT formatting and missing NS for delegated subzone.
Performed quarterly review of allow-update policies; tightened dynamic update ACLs for 3 zones.
episodes.on_call: Shift: Y. Tanaka. 1 pages. 7 tickets. Status: Stable; minor mismatch resolved and acquisition zonefile cleanup underway.

events: Migrated 16 zones; acquisition cleanup changes merged and applied cleanly through pipeline.
Enabled prefetch for another small set of POPs (84%); measured lower query bursts after TTL changes.
Ran external DNSSEC validation sweep for all signed zones; no bogus events observed; recorded proof outputs in ticket.
Updated documentation for dynamic update ACL review cadence and approval flow.
episodes.on_call: Shift: A. Morales. 0 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Normal; smooth migration batch and DNSSEC sweep completed.

events: Large update: rotated DKIM selectors across 9 zones; propagation p95 rose and stale answers increased to 0.8% during window.
One pipeline apply failed due to conflicting record ownership between two IaC modules; resolved by consolidating zone definition and reapplying.
TSIG failures seen on two AXFRs; traced to expired TSIG key validity metadata in secret store; regenerated key material and updated both ends.
SOA serial mismatches on 3 zones after parallel commits; introduced per-zone merge queue requirement to serialize changes.
episodes.on_call: Shift: W. Park. 3 pages. 9 tickets. Status: Elevated during DKIM rotation; stabilized after key regen and IaC ownership fix.

events: Post-DKIM rotation checks: sampled TXT answers from 15 external resolvers; confirmed new selectors present and old removed as expected.
Migrated 16 zones; enforced per-zone merge queue policy; no SOA serial mismatches observed.
Updated secret store rotation procedure for TSIG keys with explicit expiry metadata; added alert 7 days before expiry.
Closed out IaC module ownership conflict by adding CI check for duplicate record definitions.
episodes.on_call: Shift: S. Mehta. 1 pages. 5 tickets. Status: Stable; preventive controls added for TSIG key lifecycle and IaC duplication.

events: Enabled prefetch coverage to 86% after adding two resolver POPs; monitored for unexpected upstream query spikes and saw none significant.
Performed routine DNSSEC signature refresh verification; ensured RRSIG expiration lead time remains within policy window.
Reviewed and pruned unused TSIG keys from key registry; removed 6 retired keys and updated access lists.
Ran quarterly zone transfer test suite; confirmed AXFR/IXFR behavior and transfer ACLs across cloud endpoints.
episodes.on_call: Shift: J. Reed. 0 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Normal; hygiene tasks completed and prefetch coverage expanded.

events: Dynamic updates spiked due to a misconfigured internal client updating multiple TXT records per minute; propagation p95 rose and sync queue depth reached 12.
One change set failed after exceeding per-zone change batch limit in provider API; split into smaller batches and re-applied.
TSIG failures correlated with increased transfer volume; confirmed keys correct and mitigated by staggering transfers (reduced parallelism).
Rolled back one TTL reduction (180->60) after observing increased stale answers during the update spike; restored to 1800.
episodes.on_call: Shift: O. Bennett. 4 pages. 10 tickets. Status: Degraded during dynamic update spike; mitigated by batching, staggering transfers, and correcting client behavior.

events: Corrected internal client update frequency and confirmed dynamic updates returned to baseline; propagation p95 normalized.
Migrated final planned batch for the month (16 zones); executed parity tests and DS checks where applicable.
Refined change batching logic in pipeline to respect provider limits; added unit tests for batch splitting.
Closed incident follow-up: documented transfer staggering approach and added alert on sync queue depth > 10.
episodes.on_call: Shift: M. Duarte. 1 pages. 6 tickets. Status: Stable; recovered from prior spike and completed month-end migration batch.

events: Increased resolver prefetch coverage to 88%; verified no adverse effects on authoritative QPS patterns.
Performed month-end reconciliation: zones/records counts matched between on-prem exports and cloud-managed inventory for migrated set.
Validated backup and restore procedure for zone data in cloud provider; completed restore drill on a non-production zone.
Reviewed upcoming cutover plan for remaining on-prem zones; updated checklist for AXFR freeze and final serial bump.
episodes.on_call: Shift: K. Shah. 0 pages. 3 tickets. Status: Normal; reconciliation and recovery drills completed.

events: Start-of-month migration push: onboarded 16 zones, including several with complex SRV and CAA sets; parity tests passed.
Applied TTL harmonization across 12 zones to 1800 for most records; coordinated with app owners and logged approvals.
Ran DNSSEC enablement for 2 zones previously unsigned; published DS records and validated from multiple resolvers.
Updated on-call playbook to include step-by-step for final on-prem cutover (freeze updates, AXFR snapshot, final serial bump, delegation switch).
episodes.on_call: Shift: A. Lee. 1 pages. 8 tickets. Status: Stable; migration continues with standardized TTLs and expanding DNSSEC coverage.
